TopicTitle: Can we please allow keyboard entry for wings?

Articles.Content:
I want exactly 0.13. Not 0.12, nor 0.14. Slipping to 0.15 because I'm stuck using the slider is just outlandish.

Can we please allow keyboard input for unit parameters?

PLEASE
Same, but may I ask, why 0.13?

49 minutes ago, Little 908 said:

Same, but may I ask, why 0.13?

Well, usually it's between 0.04 and 0.06, but I recently had a run in with a 0.13 that just about took my sanity.

Keyboard input would also help a great deal when building a wing out of multiple parts and you're trying to match the tip length of the inner one with the root length of the outer one.

The slider can easily read 0.12 on both with them still not matching up because one is on the lower end of 0.12 and the other is on the higher end.

It's like it's own minigame:

"Who can hit their intended number with the fewest passes on the slider?... GO!"

If I keep this frame of reference I feel like I'm getting a lot more for my money.

50 minutes ago, Socraticat said:

If I keep this frame of reference I feel like I'm getting a lot more for my money.

@Socraticatyou're true to your name. A true stoic philosopher.  I played KSP1 on Xbox and the slider input drove me nuts, until an update allowed for keyboard-ish input.

Why this was not the baseline feature for KSP2 on PC boggles the mind. I'd like to see keyboard inputs for sliders in KSP2. Until then the minigame will have to do, but it rates up there with Chocobo Racing in FFVII
I second (or sixth) this. Numerical entry as an alternative to sliders should be basic design in all software that has them.
I second generally allowing keyboard entry. It was a great improvement in KSP 1 and simply must be available.
